title: 114_hr476
content:
The "GI Bill Education Quality Enhancement Act of 2015" is also known as the Short Title. State Approving Agencies play a role as outlined in the Act. The "GI Bill Education Quality Enhancement Act of 2015" amends approval processes for education programs under title 38, United States Code. State approving agencies are granted authority in determining approved programs. The "GI Bill Education Quality Enhancement Act of 2015" amends approval processes for education programs under title 38, United States Code by updating subsection (b) to include the State approving agency or the Secretary when acting in the role of a State approving agency. SEC. 3. Amends criteria for approving nonaccredited courses to ensure equitable treatment of educational institutions. Applies to investigations covered by reimbursement of expenses to States by the Secretary of Veterans Affairs. 

SEC. 4. Clarifies assistance for certain flight training programs. Amends subsection (c)(1)(A) of section 3313 of the title to specify that the Secretary may not pay for fees related to flight training in determining the actual net cost for in-State tuition and fees at public institutions of higher learning. Amends subsection (c)(1)(A) of section 3313 of the title to specify that the Secretary may not pay for fees related to flight training in determining the actual net cost for in-State tuition and fees at public institutions of higher learning. In clause (ii), items are redesignated and subclauses are reorganized for programs of education. The amendments made by subsection (a) apply to programs of education pursued at non-public or foreign institutions of higher learning, as well as at public institutions where flight training is required for the degree being pursued. The amendments made by subsection (a) apply to programs of education pursued at non-public or foreign institutions of higher learning, as well as at public institutions where flight training is required for the degree being pursued, with respect to a quarter, semester, or term, commencing on or after the date of the enactment of this Act. SEC. 5. COMPLIANCE SURVEYS. The Secretary shall conduct annual compliance surveys of educational institutions offering courses for eligible veterans to ensure compliance with relevant provisions. The Secretary shall assign education compliance specialists to conduct surveys of educational institutions and training establishments annually to ensure compliance with relevant provisions. The parameters of the surveys will be determined in consultation with State approving agencies, and a list of institutions to be surveyed will be provided by September 1 each year. The definition of 'training establishment' is provided in section 3452 of this title. Conforming amendments to the section include changes to the compliance survey requirements for educational institutions or training establishments.
